title: [$250] If an expense report is not eligible to have reports moved to it, don't show it in the list

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757535644671009) ## Action Performed: **Account pre-reqs:** instant submit is turned on, there are no approvers in the workflow, and the report that you are going to move expenses to contains only non-reimbursable expenses. 1. Select expenses on an open report 2. Click More > move expenses 3. Select the report that meets the **account pre-reqs** from above 4. You will see that the expenses do not move to the new report, and there is no error message or warning to indicate to the customer why ## Expected Result: What should happen is that the report that is ineligible to have expenses moved to it should not even appear in the list of reports as an option to select. ## Notes from engineering: If a workspace has instant submit with no approvers, they cannot add an expense to a nonreimbursable-only report (for example, a non-reimbursable pending card expense) as these are closed automatically ``` if (Policy::isInstantSubmitEnabledWithNoApprovers(db, Report::getPolicyID(db, newMoneyRequestReportID)) && Report::hasOnlyNonReimbursableTransactions(db, newMoneyRequestReportID)) { SINFO("User is trying to add expense to Non-Reimbursable report: " << newMoneyRequestReportID << " on a policy with Instant Submit Enabled and No Approvers. "); STHROW("403 New request cannot be added to this report"); } ``` ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c259c1e-7e58-4be3-93c8-2cbe5482b78e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Clarify Approval Options When Held Expenses Exist

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.12-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A New Feature **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ted@expensify.com **Logs:** N/A **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @twisterdotcom **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#product](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1757509841450259) ## Action Performed: 1. Open an expense report containing both compliant and held expenses. 2. Observe the "Approve" button at the top of the report. 3. Click the "Approve" button. 4. A modal appears prompting the user to choose between approving only unheld expenses or approving the entire report. ## Expected Result: When held expenses exist, the approval flow should make the two approval options clear **before** clicking "Approve." The user should not see a misleading single total on the main button. Instead, the button should explicitly allow the user to choose between: - Approve only unheld expenses (with correct amount shown) - Approve all expenses (with correct amount shown) ## Actual Result: The "Approve" button always shows the full report total even if some expenses are held. Only after clicking does a modal appear, forcing the user to choose. This creates confusion, as the primary action does not align with the amounts shown. ## Workaround: Users can still approve reports by making a selection in the modal, but the flow is unclear and can cause hesitation or mistakes. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0b8d23a3-ae0e-4e41-b6f3-c53587a892b2 - Demonstrates how the modal appears after clicking "Approve," requiring the user to choose between two totals. [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22) cc @shawnborton, @JmillsExpensify, @puneetlath, @dubielzyk-expensify.

Open app and login. 2. Create a new workspace (skip if you have one already). 3. Go to Workspace > Reports and enable Report fields. 4. Copy Default report title formula from the section above: `{report:type} {report:startdate}`. 5. In the Report fields section click [+] Add field. 6. Add a random field Name and select Type > Text. 7. Paste the formula copied at step 4 into the the Initial value field. 8. Click Save > Save. ## Expected Result: The Report field should be created without the app crashing. ## Actual Result: The app crashes after saving a Text type report field using Formula as input, including crashing on any subsequent attempts to open Workspace > Reports page. title: [$250] Clean up report page styles

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Now that we have collapsible rows on the Reports page, we want to take a moment to clean up some of the styles. Right now, especially on mobile, the table style feels quite heavy and unbalanced: So we'd like to adjust some styles to: - use a consistent normal text weight for titles and totals - on mobile, reduce the size of the From/To avatar, reduce the font weight, and make it so that the From/To is at the top of the row - use an "extra small" button size on mobile - this will bring the buttons from 28px -> 20px tall The result is this: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d9d2b979-755d-4a42-81d2-240e1f1632c1 More in depth mocks for posterity: cc @Expensify/design to make sure we're good with the above changes, cc @Expensify/product-pr for extra eyes too

Coming from this [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757073337935249?thread_ts=1757033779.685039&cid=C05LX9D6E07) We can see that the `createOptionList` is still one of the main heavy hitters when it comes to performance. Investigate how we could: - optimise the method itself - make sure its recomputed/ called fewer times only when really necessary - create automated tests to try to prevent regressions around this method

title: [$250] Remove SearchContext from the useOnyx when not needed

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
Coming from [this proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757511640708319) ### Background The useOnyx hook (a wrapper around the original useOnyx) is used throughout the app. Inside it, we subscribe to SearchContext so the hook can return data from either the regular Onyx keys or the special SNAPSHOT keys (which are specifically designed for the Reports page). However, useOnyx hooks that are not used on the Reports page don’t need SearchContext, since they don’t rely on currentSearchHash (which is only used to access the current SNAPSHOT data). ### Problem If SearchContext changes, then every useOnyx in the App will rerender. Such context change will trigger rerenders in screens that are rendered in the history, preloaded screens or modals that live outside of navigation like SearchRouter and can cause massive overhead. ### Solution Avoid useOnyx calls outside the Reports/Search tree from subscribing to SearchContext. How: SearchContext provides components with isOnSearch prop that with the help of SearchScopeProvider tells us if the useOnyx is part of Search/index component tree(is on Reports page). To reduce rerenders, we could: - take isOnSearch prop out of SearchContext and put it in SearchScopeProvider , isOnSearch doesn't trigger rerenders as it is a static prop. - in useOnyx use the new use API to conditionally listen to SearchContext, that way useOnyx hooks that are part of Search/index component tree(this is static) will access SearchContext that they need and useOnyx hooks that don't need it won't rerender. ``` const useOnyx: OriginalUseOnyx = >(key: TKey, options?: UseOnyxOptions, dependencies?: DependencyList) => { const {isOnSearch} = useIsOnSearch(); let currentSearchHash: number | undefined; if (isOnSearch) { const {currentSearchHash: searchContextCurrentSearchHash} = use(SearchContext); currentSearchHash = searchContextCurrentSearchHash; } ... rest of useOnyx hook ... ``` Benefits This will provide big boost to scenarios where SearchContext changes, examples(perf measured on iOS simulator): 1. On Reports page the user changes search type with the search type menu(Submit -> Pay): - OLD: total React work: 7234.014ms - ~55 commits - NEW: total React work: 5357.51 - 48 commits (25%/1877 ms better) 3. After fresh log into the app, user enters Reports page and then goes back to Inbox: - OLD: total React work: 5992.427ms - ~67 commits - NEW: total React work: 4890.688 - 59 commits (18%/1102 ms better)
